Module Collections
Package collections.stack

Class RecyclingStack<T>

java.lang.Object
collections.stack.RecyclingStack<T>
Type Parameters:
T - The type of data stored in the stack.
All Implemented Interfaces:
Iterable<T>
public class RecyclingStack<T> extends Object implements Iterable<T>
A specialized stack implementation that supports recycling of nodes, improving memory efficiency by reusing allocated nodes instead of creating new ones. This recycling is especially useful in scenarios where there is a frequent push-pop cycle.
Since:
1.0

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    RecyclingStack()
    Constructs an empty RecyclingStack without allocating the pool.

    Constructs a RecyclingStack with an initial pool size.

      Pushes a new node with the provided data onto the stack.
      Parameters:
      data - The data to be pushed onto the stack.
      Returns:
      The node at the top of the stack after the push operation.

    • pop

      public T pop()
      Pops the top node from the stack and returns its data.
      Returns:
      The data of the popped node, or null if the stack is empty.

    • peek

      public T peek()
      Peeks at the data of the top node without removing it.
      Returns:
      The data of the top node, or null if the stack is empty.
